verses.kjv: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.
verses.ct: This is the account of the descendants of Noah's sons — Shem, Ham, and Japheth. They had sons after the flood.

verses.kjv: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
verses.ct: Japheth's sons were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.ct: Gomer's sons were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
verses.ct: Javan's sons were Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

verses.kjv: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.
verses.ct: From these descendants, the coastal peoples spread out into their own territories, each group with its own language, organized by clans and nations.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.
verses.ct: Ham's sons were Cush, Mizraim, Phut, and Canaan.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: and the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
verses.ct: Cush's sons were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabtechah. Raamah's sons were Sheba and Dedan.

verses.kjv: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.
verses.ct: Cush became the father of Nimrod, who grew to be the first powerful ruler on the earth.

verses.kjv: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.
verses.ct: He was a legendary hunter in the presence of the LORD. That is why people say, "Like Nimrod, the legendary hunter in the presence of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
verses.ct: His kingdom started with Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, all in the land of Shinar.

verses.kjv: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,
verses.ct: From that region, Asshur went out and built Nineveh, the city of Rehoboth, and Calah,

verses.kjv: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.
verses.ct: as well as Resen, located between Nineveh and Calah — that is the great city.

verses.kjv: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
verses.ct: Mizraim became the father of the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, and the Naphtuhim,

verses.kjv: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.
verses.ct: as well as the Pathrusim and the Casluhim (from whom the Philistim descended) and the Caphtorim.

verses.kjv: And Canaan begat Sidon his first born, and Heth,
verses.ct: Canaan became the father of Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth,

verses.kjv: And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,
verses.ct: along with the Jebusites, the Amorites, and the Girgasites,

verses.kjv: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,
verses.ct: the Hivites, the Arkites, and the Sinites,

verses.kjv: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
verses.ct: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Later, the Canaanite clans scattered in every direction.

verses.kjv: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest, unto Sodom, and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.
verses.ct: The Canaanite territory stretched from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, as far as Lasha.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.
verses.ct: These were Ham's descendants, organized by their clans, languages, territories, and nations.

verses.kjv: Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born.
verses.ct: Shem, the older brother of Japheth, also had children. Shem was the ancestor of all the descendants of Eber.

verses.kjv: The children of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
verses.ct: Shem's sons were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.

verses.kjv: And the children of Aram; Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
verses.ct: Aram's sons were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

verses.kjv: And Arphaxad begat Salah; and Salah begat Eber.
verses.ct: Arphaxad became the father of Salah, and Salah became the father of Eber.

verses.kjv: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother’s name was Joktan.
verses.ct: Eber had 2 sons. One was named Peleg, because during his lifetime the earth was divided. His brother was named Joktan.

verses.kjv: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
verses.ct: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

verses.kjv: And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
verses.ct: as well as Hadoram, Uzal, and Diklah,

verses.kjv: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
verses.ct: Obal, Abimael, and Sheba,

verses.kjv: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.ct: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All of these were Joktan's sons.

verses.kjv: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar a mount of the east.
verses.ct: Their territory extended from Mesha all the way to Sephar, in the eastern hill country.

verses.kjv: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.
verses.ct: These were Shem's descendants, organized by their clans, languages, territories, and nations.

verses.kjv: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
verses.ct: These are the clans of Noah's sons, listed by their lines of descent within their nations. From these families, the nations spread across the earth after the flood.
